title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22ยง 12.1 - Attendance of Incarcerated Persons at Judicial Hearings
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22ยง 12.1 - Attendance of Incarcerated Persons at Judicial Hearings

State Regulations

Whenever a court directs the temporary removal of an
incarcerated person from an institution under the jurisdiction of the State

Department of Correctional Services for the purposes of attendance at a
judicial hearing, its order shall recite that the hearing therein provided must
be held within 30 days of the arrival of the incarcerated person at the
temporary place of detention. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22ยง
12.1

York State Register January 24, 2024/Volume XLVI, Issue 4, eff. 1/24/2024

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
